meanings.definition: The act of giving someone the right to vote or the right to participate in a decision-making process.
meanings.sent1: The enfranchisements in the country allowed more people to have a say in how things are run.
meanings.sent2: The enfranchisements of women in the early 20th century marked a significant step towards equality.
meanings.sent3: After the enfranchisements, everyone wanted to vote for the same candidate, causing a funny chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her enfranchisements into the political world opened up a whole new realm of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The enfranchisements brought a fresh breeze of democracy into the society.

meanings.definition: The state of being granted a privilege or freedom, especially in terms of citizenship or property ownership.
meanings.sent1: The enfranchisements of land to the villagers improved their quality of life.
meanings.sent2: Citizenship enfranchisements are crucial for ensuring equal rights for all individuals.
meanings.sent3: The enfranchisements of free ice cream on Fridays made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His enfranchisements in the company gave him the power to make important decisions.
meanings.sent5: The enfranchisements of new members brought fresh perspectives to the team.
